#define RESET_RELOAD_APPLICATION_TIMER()
 Reset the internal variables used for the application timer and reload the timer itself.
#define PWM_SETPOINT   0x64
 configure pwm timer, we use timer2 for this 0xF2=4,8% duty cycle, 0xE6=10%, 0x01=100% The 74HCT573 is active low, changed to 0x33=51 -> This is about 20% negative duty cycle
#define PWM_DELAY_TIME   10
 How long we hold the relais at 100% before we enable PWM again.

Detailed Description

The relais application to switch 8 relais Manufactorer code is 0x04 = Jung
Device type (2038.10) 0x2060 Ordernumber: 2138.10REG
.

Author:
Matthias Fechner, Christian Bode
Date:
Sat Jan 05 17:44:47 2008

To enable IO test compile with -DIO_TEST

Define Documentation

#define PWM_DELAY_TIME   10

How long we hold the relais at 100% before we enable PWM again.

Referenced by switchObjects().

#define PWM_SETPOINT   0x64

configure pwm timer, we use timer2 for this 0xF2=4,8% duty cycle, 0xE6=10%, 0x01=100% The 74HCT573 is active low, changed to 0x33=51 -> This is about 20% negative duty cycle

Referenced by restartApplication(), and timerOverflowFunction().

 
#define RESET_RELOAD_APPLICATION_TIMER (  ) 
Value:
{      \
        currentTimeOverflow=0;                  \
        currentTimeOverflowBuffer=0;            \
        currentTime=0;                          \
        RELOAD_APPLICATION_TIMER();             \
    }

Reset the internal variables used for the application timer and reload the timer itself.

uint8_t restartApplication ( void   ) 

Function is called when microcontroller gets power or if the application must be restarted.

It restores data like in the parameters defined.

Returns:
FB_ACK or FB_NACK

References anspringen_k1, anspringen_k2, currentTime, currentTimeOverflow, eeprom_ParamRead(), einschathellikeit_k1, einschathellikeit_k2, ENABLE_PWM, hellikeit, IO_OUTPUT, K1dimmwert, MAXDIMMWERT, mindimmwert_k1, mindimmwert_k2, portValue, PWM_SETPOINT, RELOAD_APPLICATION_TIMER, switchObjects(), timerRunning, and waitToPWM.

Here is the call graph for this function:

uint8_t runApplication ( struct msg *  rxmsg  ) 

Function is called if A_GroupValue_Write is received.

Function is called if A_GroupValue_Write is received it is the function "EIS1" or "Data Type Boolean" for the relais module.

The type it is the function "EIS1" or "Data Type Boolean" for the relais module. Read all parameters in that function and set global variables.

Parameters:
rxmsg 
Returns:
The return value defies if a ACK or a NACK should be sent (FB_ACK, FB_NACK)

Todo:

void timerOverflowFunction ( void   ) 

Timer1 is used as application timer.

It increase the variable currentTime every 130ms and currentTimeOverflow if currentTime runs over 16-bit.

Returns:
Todo:
test interrupt lock in this function that it is not disturbing TX and RX of telegrams

Todo:

parameterstructure (RAM)

uint8_t portValue [static]

defines the port status.

LSB IO0 and MSB IO8, ports with delay can be set to 1 here but will be switched delayed depending on the delay

Referenced by readApplication(), restartApplication(), runApplication(), switchObjects(), and timerOverflowFunction().

const STRUCT_DEFPARAM defaultParam [] PROGMEM
Initial value:
    {
        { MANUFACTORER_ADR,        0x04 },    
        { DEVICE_NUMBER_HIGH,      0x20 },    
        { DEVICE_NUMBER_LOW,       0x60 },    
        { SOFTWARE_VERSION_NUMBER, 0x01 },    
        { APPLICATION_RUN_STATUS,  0xFF },    
        { COMMSTAB_ADDRESS,        0x9A },    
        { APPLICATION_PROGRAMM,    0x00 },    

        { 0x0000,                  0x00 },    
        { 0x01EA,                  0x00 },    
        { 0x01F6,                  0x55 },    
        { 0x01F7,                  0x55 },    
        { 0x01F2,                  0x00 },    

        { PA_ADDRESS_HIGH,         0x11 },    
        { PA_ADDRESS_LOW,          0x33 },       

        { 0xFF,                    0xFF }     
    }
